intro: Ophiria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, often yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants typically have lance-shaped leaves and are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa. Ophiria species are often found in moist, woodland habitats and can thrive in partial to full shade. They are valued in gardens for their ornamental beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
